definitions.definition: extremely silly; not logical and sensible

examples.text: That uniform makes the guards look absurd.
Of course it's not true, what an absurd idea.
She found the whole concept faintly absurd.
Don't be absurd! Why would he want to do a thing like that?
I must say I felt faintly absurd.
It's absurd to suggest that I'm being unprofessional.

definitions.definition: things that are or that seem to be absurd

examples.text: He has a good sense of the absurd.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from Latin absurdus ‘out of tune’, hence ‘irrational’; related to surdus ‘deaf, dull’.
